intro: Hymenoxys bigelovii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has hairy, lobed leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open plains. Hymenoxys bigelovii is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
